etymology.description: semantic: 口 + phonetic: 十 (ancient variant of 協); later borrowed to write 葉.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 口 as the semantic element and 十 as the phonetic, forming an old variant of 協 ‘to cooperate’. Due to homophony with 葉 in some Northern Wu varieties, this form was repurposed to write ‘leaf’ and was later standardized as the simplified character.
etymology.simplification: Adopted an existing, simpler variant 叶 (originally tied to 協) as the simplified form for 葉 because of homophony; it replaced 艹+枼 with 口+十.

examples.chinese: 秋天，树上的叶子变黄了(秋天，樹上的葉子變黃了)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān, shù shàng de yèzi biàn huáng le.
examples.english: In autumn, the leaves on the trees turn yellow.

examples.chinese: 这棵榕树的叶很大(這棵榕樹的葉很大)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kē róngshù de yè hěn dà.
examples.english: The leaves of this banyan tree are very large.

examples.chinese: 她姓叶，来自上海(她姓葉，來自上海)。
examples.english: Her surname is Ye, and she is from Shanghai.
